chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph A Goldberg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DA has 30 days to prepare/submit order.
$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $278  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified. DNA on file.   Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

Associated with Charge #1
Copy of minutes from PLEAS Hrg on 7/25/22 sent electronically to DCJ.

IN CUSTODY AT FOND DU LAC COUNTY JAIL
02:24 PM  Defendant Joseph A Goldberg appeared by video means with Attorney Kathleen Chung. Prosecuting Atty Rebekah M Rennicke appeared for State of Wisconsin.Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 


On Motion of the State, the Court DRI Count 2.

 Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT 1  
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for  2 years

CONDITIONS:
-Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals 
-DNA on file
-Restitution: (State has 30  days to prepare an order)
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct 1
-DNA surcharge waived
-All other CC due on probation




-Days credit for time already served:  13 days
-Days credit if revoked: 13 days

DE advised of post-conviction rights
